title: Can a Bail Bondsman garnish, social security disability and SSI payments ?
question: Last year my friend bailed her son out of jail. The agreement was that he would make the monthly payments , He never made 1 payment and now the Bail Bondman office is calling my friend and making threats that they are garnishing her Social Security Disability and her SSI payments. Her son is back in jail and her income is so low that there is nothing left after she pays her living expenses. My question is " Can the Bail Bondsman garnish SS Disability and SSI payments ? " Thank you !
answers: He can get a judgment. What he can collect is more complicated. Some of her income is protected, but she put herself at risk, unfortunately.

The bondsman would not be able to garnish her Social Security benefits, unless her bank account is garnished. Social Security benefits are protected from creditors through a non-assignment statute in Title 42 of the U.S. Code.

The bondsman would need to file a civil lawsuit. Unless you default, the case will be set for trial. If the bondsman wins, he/she gets a civil judgment. This judgment can be enforced against your "non-exempt" assets. Necessities of life are exempt from levy. Social security benefits are exempt. The bank account into which SS benefits are deposited are exempt for 90 days. The judgment creditor can garnish up to 25% of your wages, unless that would create a hardship. The judgment creditor can levy upon such things as any apartment buildings, office buildings, airplanes, yachts, luxury automobiles (Ferraris, Bentleys, Rolls Royces the do not have big loans), stocks, bonds, and any pot of gold that you keep around your home.
